Package Model

Class HelperFunctions

java.lang.Object
Model.HelperFunctions
public class HelperFunctions extends Object
Class that holds repeating logic and functions to be reused in different methods.

  • Method Details

    • isAmountValid

      public static boolean isAmountValid(int stock, int min, int max, javafx.scene.control.TextField NameTextField, javafx.scene.control.Label SourceLabel, javafx.scene.control.TextField SourceField)
      Method to determine if a Food is valid. Will return true if Min greater than Max. Will return true if Max is greater than or equal to Stock and Min is less than or equal to Stock. Will return true if the Name text field is not empty. Will return true if the Company Name text field is not empty. Will trigger an Alert Error with the appropriate messages for the fields that are not valid. If none of the above logic errors are found, the first if block returns false. The final return of the method is True-> all fields are valid. The method uses a HashMap to access the error message to the error. The values of the HashMap contain the error messages. Once the keys are match with an error, the values are added to a String "errorBlock". The String "errorBlock" is set to the content on the error alert.
      Parameters:
      stock - the stock of the Food.
      min - the min value of the Food.
      max - the max value of the Food.
      NameTextField - the text field holding the name of the Food.
      SourceField - the text holding the CompanyName
      SourceLabel - the label determining if outsourced.
      Returns:
      boolean

    • isInputValid

      public static boolean isInputValid(int stock, int min, int max, javafx.scene.control.TextField NameTextField)
      Method to determine if a Dish is valid. Will return true if Min greater than Max. Will return true if Max is greater than or equal to Stock and Min is less than or equal to Stock. Will return true if the Name text field is not empty. Will trigger an Alert Error with the appropriate messages for the fields that are not valid. If none of the above logic errors are found, the first if block returns false. The final return of the method is True-> all fields are valid. The method uses a HashMap to access the error message to the error. The values of the HashMap contain the error messages. Once the keys are match with an error, the values are added to a String "errorBlock". The String "errorBlock" is set to the content on the error alert.
      Parameters:
      stock - the stock of the Dish.
      min - the min value of the Dish.
      max - the max value of the Dish.
      NameTextField - the text field holding the name of the Dish.
      Returns:
      boolean

      Determine if part is associated with a product, return boolean false if not.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      boolean. Implemented in MainScreen see linked:
